H0.text: The initial velocity of the object is a factor that determines the rate of acceleration of an object, along with its mass.

H1.text: The forces acting on the object, together with its mass, determine the rate of acceleration of an object.

H2.text: The direction of movement of the object is a factor that determines the rate of acceleration of an object, along with the object's mass.

H3.text: The change in kinetic energy of the object is a factor that, together with the object's mass, determines the rate of acceleration of an object.

A4.text: Newton's second law, in modern form, states that the time derivative of the momentum is the force: F = dp/dt.

A5.text: The acceleration is the same for all bodies, independently of their mass.

A6.text: The force of gravity on an object at the Earth's surface is directly proportional to the object's mass.
